column1: starts with a full toss! It's straight, pushed to the on side
short, some width outside off, he drives off the back foot and it flies in the air wide of backward point to third man
almost a run out! Was full and straight, off the pad into the leg side, Azam wanted the run and has to turn around quickly. The dive would have just saved him
tucked off the pads to square leg
back of a length outside off, angled wide of backward point to third man and there's good running to make the second
a strangled appeal for a catch down the leg side, was speared in at leg stump, just glances the pad through to Carey. Starc searching for early swing
lovely shot, full outside off, into position and drives elegantly wide of mid-off...perfect timing
that's even better! Richardson dragged the length back, Azam punches it through the covers off the back foot. The outfield is rapid!
banged in back of a length, nips back and takes an inside edge into the pads
short of a length, straight, whipped through midwicket
short outside off, he crunches a pull but picks out short midwicket who parries it away
full outside off, not much footwork as he drives square to point
and again! That's a cracker. Short of a length outside off, stand and deliver from Azam as he stands tall and drives through the covers
that's timed nicely as well, driven square but this time picks out cover
short outside off, driven from the back foot and finds short cover who has just been moved into position
that's another brilliant stroke, he's flying, as Starc drops short on his hip and it's a whip-pull to deep square leg
there's the yorker, at off stump, dug out to point and that just shaped back a fraction
short of a length outside off, square drives to point and Azam lets out a scream that he didn't find the gap. It's coming off the middle so far
over the wicket, full at the stumps, 137kph, defended to the bowler
finds mid-off! So another failure for Zaman as he tries to get going. Stayed leg-side of a full delivery, sliced across the delivery, sends a pretty straightforward catch to Warner
back of a length at off stump, 140kph, pushed to the covers
a bouncer over middle and off, he ducks underneath...terrific start from Cummins. Four dots and a wicket
slips on the pads this time, clipped in front of square which means there's a couple on offer
gets forward into a length ball and drives to mid-off, deep enough for the single as he has to move to his right
short of a length on leg stump, worked to deep square
back of a length outside off, opens the face and pushes into point
touch fuller, at off stump, 125kph, pushed to the covers
short of a length, slides off the face to backward point, touch slower at 120kph
full outside off, Sohail drives high over cover, not perfectly timed but it's wide of the sweeper
he's done it again! Another ugly swipe sees the downfall of Sohail. Back of a length, he swings to the leg side, takes a big top edge and Richardson settles under the simple catch
full at off stump, push and run towards mid-on...tight, but think he was safe. Takes him off strike again
back of a length, straight, played to the on side
touch fuller, 141kph, hits the splice hard as Rizwan pushes to the on side
short of a length, takes an inside edge into his boot and trickles to the off side
fuller, at the stumps, worked towards mid-on and he scampers the single...Warner didn't collect cleanly anyway
full and straight, pushed into the covers
starts with a reasonably flat delivery, driven to deep cover
dragged down short, angled into leg stump, pulled to deep midwicket
uses his feet, think Zampa saw him coming and dragged the length shorter, pushed to the off side
a googly, driven to long-off
full and straight, a wristy flick to deep midwicket
nearly through him! Plays back to a skidding googly, manages to get the bat down in time and finds point...that was heading for middle stump
fantastic work from Agar off his own bowling! Rizwan drives to his right, Agar flings himself and pulls off a one-handed save then flicks the ball back to Carey. Rizwan has to dive.
full at leg stump, flicked off the toes to deep square
tucked round the corner to short fine leg
there he goes! Skips down the pitch and drives inside out over cover, but long-off keeps it to a single
touch shorter outside off, pushed to deep cover
nicely bowled, does Rizwan in the flight as he comes down the pitch. Deflects off the pads to the off side
moves outside leg stump then brings out a strong slog-sweep that goes wide of long-on
wider outside off, think that was the googly, dabbed to short third man
some power in that! Swift footwork, skips down the pitch, and plays a stinging straight drive that almost takes Zampa's foot with it
taken from outside off through mid-on, Zampa chases himself and that's a well-worked two
a googly, he comes forward and it takes a thick inside edge to the leg side
down the pitch and drives off the cue end to long-off
moves away outside leg, drives to cover and runs...has to bring out the dive
short on the pads, paddles this wide of short fine leg...doesn't quite get hauled back in by McDermott running from deep square. He actually got there, but flicked it into himself
inside edge into the pads as he aims to leg
short of a length, worked to long-on
done all ends up! He started to move outside leg very early, Agar fired it in towards leg stump, it spears between bat and pad. Simple stumping for Carey
102kph, fired in at off, he defends on the front foot
96kph, slid into leg, he glances it wide of short fine
drifting into leg, he whips through square leg to the sweeper
93kph, looped full, he skips out and drives to long on, he pushes for two but hit it too well
flatter drifting into leg, he glances this to short fine leg
drifting into middle, 93kph, he skips down and clips it to long on
96kph, very full he dances down and drives very firmly straight of long, Warner is stretched on the rope, easy two
skips down and drives straight of long, Babar wants two but Asif sends him back. Babar yells at him. Easy two there

slog sweep straight down long on's throat! Easy catch for Cummins. Babar will be furious. He should have been on strike. It was darted in outside off, he was down on one knee and slog sweeps trying to find the rope, he miscued hitting it straight to long on.
flatter on leg, he's back and whipping to deep midwicket
shorter, he's back and working this to deep midwicket
fuller on off, 90kph, he drives but Agar dives to make the save and force a dot
fired full into leg stump, he clips this to deep midwicket for one
137kph, angled into leg, he glances in the air towards fine leg but it's short of the man
137kph, shorter length, he's back and pulling with a short arm jab to deep midwicket
136kph, back of a length, top of off, he's pushes a defensive prod to cover but there's no run
137kph, short into the ribs. he's inside the line and pulling powerfully between fine leg and deep square, Starc has to slide on the rope to prevent four
back of a length, of off, it climbs and hits the sticker of the bat, and drops down
138kph, short ball, at the chest, he swivels and pulls from low to high but miscues towards fine leg
95kph, slid through, he's back trying to pull but it hurried him, he chops a bottom edge behind the keeper
shorter length, he's back and pulling to deep midwicket
95kph, shorter length, wide of off, he late cuts to short third man
flatter ball, skidding through, he's back and cutting to cover
95kph, flighted higher outside off, he square drives to deep point
97kph, shorter length, he's back and punching to deep midwicket
135kph, beaten flashing and missing trying to cut one. Beaten by some extra bounce
135kph, back of a length, top of off, he stays leg side and punched to backward point
over wide mid off! There we go. Some intent. This was a good length outside off, he opened the chest and sliced it on the up high over mid off who is up
thumped over square leg into the crowd! Bang! Short slower ball and he picked it, it was in the hitting zone and he smoked it over deep square
136kph, full outside off, this is hammered through cover-point, Warner has to sprint a long way from deep point to dive full length to save two runs
139kph, low full toss, attempted yorker, crunched hard straight of long on, McDermott has to work very hard to slide and save this
he skips out early, Agar goes round arm, 93kph, sliding it into the pads, it bounces away for a leg bye
104kph, arm ball darted into leg, but heave from Iftikhar but he mistimes it to deep midwicket
charges early again, dropped in shorter, he stands up and drives to long on
lofted over cover! Powerful strike. Tossed up outside off, he clears the front leg and lifts it flat over cover to find the rope
106kph, wide half volley, he square drives firmly to deep point

run out by a direct hit going for two! Warner unbelievable from deep midwicket! Babar just knocked this outside the circle at midwicket, he ran one to reach his 12th T20I fifty, he called for two, Warner raced in off the rope, picked up one hand and whipped the throw in off balance, and hit the base of the striker's stumps! Babar dived but was inches short. Unreal from Warner
short on the hip, he clips this uppishly to fine leg but short of the man
142kph, back of a length, off stump, he stays leg side and punches off the back foot to deep point
back foot square drive! Elegant. Babar like. 137kph, back of a length, he opened the face and timed it beautifully backward of point!
142kph, length ball, top of middle, he's jammed up, defending back to the bowler
dropped by Smith at deep backward square! Full into leg stump, he clips it with the angle to deep backward square, Smith ran in and got both hands to it and spilt it! He would normally swallow those
137kph, short ball, he backs away and slaps it in the air to deep point but it bounces short of Agar
146kph, wide yorker, well bowled, he backed away too far outside leg and missed it
141kph, low full toss on leg, he miscues a drive to long on but it's straight of him and they get an easy two
144kph, very low full toss, tailing in, he clears the front leg and gets it off the toe back to the bowler
128kph, length slower ball, again he backs away too far and miscues off the toe
crunched wide of mid off! 142kph half volley and he held his position better, didn't back away too far, got a full swing of the bat through the line and picked the gap
141kph, length ball, he shapes early to reverse lap! He was beaten for pace
smacked over long off! What a shot! Full outside off, he's hanging back and hammering it through the line, clearing the man on the rope!
full and wide, he backs away too far, slices this high off the toe towards deep point but short of the man
137kph, low full toss, he swings hard but miscues to long off
top edge over Carey! 135kph, bouncer, well bowled, hurried him on the pull, gets a thick edge and it just clears Carey's outstretched glove
misfield at deep point! 50 for Iftikhar from 29 balls. He sliced this in the air to deep point, Warner ran in but it was just short of him diving forward and the bounce went over his hands

crunch over wide long on! McDermott on the rope parries it over! Length ball in the slot, he clears the front leg and smears it high over long on to the long boundary, McDermott jumps up but can't reel it in
full on middle, he hammers a straight drive and it hits the stumps at the non-striker's! Cost him four. That was hit beautifully but straight into middle stump at the other end. They pinch one
145kph, angled into leg, he clips this firmly straight to deep midwicket
142kph, back of a length, on off, he's giving room to bunt this to cover and get Iftikhar back on strike

Imad run out trying for two! Iftikhar hits a low full toss to Smith on the rope and Imad does the right thing, sprints back for two to keep Iftikhar on strike, but he couldn't beat Smith's throw. It was right on the money. So they don't lose much. Just miss out on one run.
half volley, hammered back to Starc, he sticks a hand out and it bounces away towards long on, easy two this time, Wahab is sprinting like Usain Bolt
145kph, angled into leg, he flicks this without timing behind square, they get two to finish the innings
back of a length at off stump, takes an inside edge to the leg side
nicely off the mark, short of a length outside off, Finch gets on his toes and drives backward of square to third man
135kph, short at Warner's body, it loops behind him towards keeper and slip...there's some excitement for the catch but it only came off the arm.
back of a length outside off, a strong square drive but it can't get it through the point region...however, a fumble allows them the second
hops back in the crease, 135kph, and works to the leg side
short outside off, sits up nicely and it's square driven through the covers
round the wicket, clipped off the pads to midwicket
gets this one away, pushed across outside off and he drives it over the ring
moves outside leg this time, opens up the off side and then places this through the covers. Taken right off the stumps
fired in at leg stump, a very slingy delivery, takes the pads
touch more air and it's dispatched! Full at the stumps, Warner clubs it over wide mid-on
ooh! Extra bounce on this one and it takes the shoulder of the bat through slip...but still runs away to third man for four
full and straight, hint of inswing, driven to cover
a yorker outside off, Finch plays over the top of it
poor delivery, short outside off, a beautifully timed square drive through point
tightens the line to off stump, pushed to the covers
a touch of shape on this one, Finch stays on leg stump and pushes a good-length delivery into the covers
WARNER IS OUT! Amir has cleaned him up...it's a length ball, Warner giving himself room for the drive and misses. The unbeaten run is over
round the wicket, full and straight, driven to mid-off
full at middle, pushed to long-on with a straight bat
mistimes a drive into the off side
full and straight, pushed carefully to the on side straight of midwicket
touch shorter, he goes back in the crease and works off the pads to deep square
flatter outside off and that's a perfect piece of timing as he threads it through point with a square drive...spoils a good over
short of a length at off stump, Smith is back and across, defends to the on side
keeps it short of a length outside off, Smith tries to drag it to the on side with the bottom hand and finds mid-on
fuller and off stump, he swings across the line and sends it to deep square leg...was very deep in the crease against a full delivery
back of a length, straight, pushed to cover for a tight single
just clears deep square as he whips/flicks a short-of-a-length delivery backward of square and gets the leverage required
well bowled, goes for the yorker, gets it in at leg stump and Smith jabs it to midwicket
short outside off, he goes for a booming square cut and it flies over the top edge
sure I heard a noise there but no one is interested in an appeal as Smith flashes again outside off. No mark on Snicko. Creaky bat handle!
short and pulled to deep square
short of a length outside off, 120kph, angled across and Finch doesn't make contact as he aims to drag a pull
taken at mid-off! Revenge for Irfan. He changed the angle, came round the wicket, was a length ball that Finch tried to carve over the off side and the bat twisted as he sliced across the shot
good delivery, short of a length at off stump, 138kph, defended
over the wicket, flicked off the stumps through midwicket
short outside off, punched to deep cover
back in the crease and nudges down to long-on
fuller, he leans forward and tucks along the ground through midwicket
lovely shot as he skips down the pitch and almost effortlessly lofts this straight down the ground
touch flatter, worked off the pads to deep midwicket
well bowled as he beats Smith with a back-of-a-length delivery angled across, climbs over the edge as Smith goes for a back-foot drive
that's superb batting as he learns from the previous ball, waits a fraction longer - it was a touch shorter - then glides it down to third man
cramps him for room a little, played to backward point
just over point as Smith leans back on a drive, flies in the air but with good heat and over the fielder
round the wicket, gets inside the line and works this off his hip backward of square
over the wicket, back of a length, 132kph, hints the splice hard as it's defended to cover
eases a straight delivery to deep midwicket
full at off stump, pushed in the air but it's short of cover who then allows it to bobble away
touch wider outside off, drives it with perfect placement wide of the cover sweeper. Great wrists
takes a leading edge but along the ground to the off side as he aims to tuck this to leg
swept off the stumps through fine leg
plays back and eases this down the ground to long-on
nearly finds backward point as he slices a back-foot drive, in the end it's a good save from Shadab
fuller, at the stumps, tucked to the midwicket and, oh dear, it's a no-ball. Looked a very tight call
sends down a very short slower-ball bouncer, Smith let's it go and gets the wide...the free hit carries over
and this is a big full toss which Smith heaves down the ground...average from Wahab. Another no-ball
short on the hip, pulled to fine leg
full at off stump, 145kph, driven to mid-off
short of a length, worked off the inner half of the bat through square leg
length ball outside off, driven to deep cover
direct hit from mid-off by Babar but McDermott brings the dive out which might have got him home. He pushed a length ball and set off straightaway. Easily in
82kph, tossed up, he skips down and works against the turn to square leg
looped up, 81kph, drifting into leg, he glances this behind square to the man in the deep
sweeping from wide of off, a top edge carries a long way but short of the man in the deep
85kph, drag down wide of off, he's back and cutting to deep point
96kph, flat on off, he punches back to the bowler
85kph, slower outside off, he skips out and works this to midwicket
thickish edge sliced fine of backward point! Wasn't in the air but he got enough of it to beat wide third man
back of a length, angled into the thigh pad, it skids on and hurries him and takes him on the thigh
137kph, short and wide, he punches off the back foot through cover straight of the man in the deep for two
140kph, head high bouncer, he's camped back and smoking a pull shot straight to deep square
121kph, short slower ball, he sits back and pulls with control forward of square
115kph, short slower ball, he pulls around the corner, he takes on the throw for two and this is tight! He just beats the throw with a full length dive. He's walking a tightrope Ben McDermott
85kph, drifting into leg, he whips to deep midwicket
95kph, darted into middle and leg, he clips this to wide long on, Smith calls early and sprints back for two. Great running
looped up, he steps out and defends to cover
skips down and works this to wide long on
91kph, shorter and wider, he's back and cutting to deep cover-point

LBW! Misses sweeping. He reviews after consulting Smith. He was out LBW in Melbourne against Sri Lanka and didn't review when it was missing leg. Nothing on hot spot. Nothing on RTS. No bat involved. There is no ball tracking available for that ball! The decision remains out. The only query was whether it hit in line. I think it was hitting.
85kph, leg break, he's back and working this to midwicket
shorter length, he's punching to cover-point
fuller outside off, he drives to deep cover
squared up on off, it gripped off the surface, his defensive prod squirts to backward point
beaten by a cracking leg break. Caught on the crease and it zipped past the edge
wrong un, shorter, he pushes back to the bowler
full outside off, he sits back and whips it through midwicket! Incredible shot to whip it with the bottom hand. 50 this time. Lovely knock from Smith so far
132kph, short and wide, he cuts hard behind point and stretches the man on the rope for a couple
132kph, full outside off, he is back and punching a full ball to mid off
back of a length, 131kph, wide of off, he punches off the back foot through point
135kph, back of a length, angled across, and he leaves this. That's a rare sight
131kph, short ball, he pulls but doesn't nail it, gets it to wide mid on
83kph leg break on off, he's down early to paddle sweep fine for a couple
beaten playing over the top of a leg break outside off. Beautiful shape and drop outside off
flatter and quicker on off, he defends on the front foot
shorter length, he's back and punching to cover
drifting down leg, he sweeps hard to deep backward square
shorter length, he's back and working this to midwicket
wide full toss, he's back and square driving to deep point
138kph, wide half-volley and it's not called wide. It was tight to the line but the bowler gets the call
141kph, full outside off, he shovels a square drive with no timing to deep point
smashed wide of mid off! Wide outside off, he steps back and gives room to smear it through the gap between cover and mid off!
122kph, slower ball bouncer and this one is called wide for too high. Amir is frustrated with that call
dissects the gap again past mid off! Incredible skill. Wide of off, he sat but and drives a full ball off the back foot, placing it in the gap. Stunning
back foot square drive over point! The best of the lot! Ridiculous. Full and wide, he's leaning back and slicing this over point. It went like a bullet to the rope. He's a phenomenon.
nearly runs himself out! He just bunted it to mid off and ran, Haris waltzes in from cover, picks up only needs to hit and missed! Turner was miles out
slower ball outside off, he leans back and misses
139kph, full and he punches straight down the ground past the bowler for a couple
117kph, slower ball bouncer, he tries to upper cut, gets it off the edge of the bat and it flies to fine leg for four! Everything working for Smith
thumped over mid off! Contemptuous shot. Length outside off, he set his base and smashed it up and over mid off.
113kph, slower ball, outside off, he punches off the back foot to cover
141kph, fired down the leg side and not called wide. Smith was bemused. He did step across a touch but not much
bouncer that it way too high and this is called. Correct call this time
full on leg stump, he whips this powerfully behind square to the sweeper
139kph, full wide of off, he square drives and a misfield at backward point allows the winning run
